info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 12:10AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A BAND OF BRIEF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTH CENTRAL CONNECTICUT... At 1210 AM EDT, a band of brief heavy snow along with strong gusty west winds up to 45 mph, was located along a line extending from near Richmond to Durham. Movement was east at 40 mph. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Manchester, Chicopee, East Hartford, Enfield, Southington, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Glastonbury, Newington, Vernon, Windsor, Northampton, Agawam and West Springfield. The snow will result in brief reduced visibility and may result in snow covered roads, especially across the higher elevations. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this band of heavy snow. Visibilities are below one quarter of a mile in this band of heavy snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes.
